abstract.text: There is no such thing as an x-only
key. This is to differenciate taproot x-only tweaking from BIP32 derivation EC tweaking. This functions is used in BIP341 tests.
SipHash 2-4 means c == 2 and d == 4.
A hash-based message authentication algorithm used by BIP32 key derivation in Hierarchically Deterministic (HD) wallets.

A canonical signature exists of: <30>
Where R and S are not negative (their first byte has its highest bit not set), and not
excessively padded (do not start with a 0 byte, unless an otherwise negative number follows,
in which case a single 0 byte is necessary and even required).
Generates the specified number of random bytes.
